pullRequest.body:
Removes a `HasColimit F` assumption in recognition of filtered colimits in category of types.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8644808943/job/23700705531)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8644808943/job/23700704546)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8644808943/job/23700705078)

I think your proof is very interesting! However, there is a more direct argument, which makes unnecessary the auxiliary version `isColimitOf'`:

```suggestion
/-- Recognizing filtered colimits of types. -/
noncomputable def isColimitOf (t : Cocone F) (hsurj :  x : t.pt,  i xi, x = t..app i xi)
    (hinj :
       i j xi xj,
        t..app i xi = t..app j xj   (k : _) (f : i  k) (g : j  k), F.map f xi = F.map g xj) :
    IsColimit t := by
  let  : t.pt  J := fun x => (hsurj x).choose
  let f :  (x : t.pt), F.obj ( x) := fun x => (hsurj x).choose_spec.choose
  have hf :  (x : t.pt), x = t..app _ (f x) := fun x => (hsurj x).choose_spec.choose_spec
  exact
    { desc := fun s x => s..app _ (f x)
      fac := fun s j => by
        ext y
        obtain k, l, g, eq := hinj _ _ _ _ (hf (t..app j y))
        have h := congr_fun (s..naturality g) (f (t..app j y))
        have h' := congr_fun (s..naturality l) y
        dsimp at h h' 
        rw [ h,  eq, h']
      uniq := fun s m hm => by
        ext x
        dsimp
        nth_rw 1 [hf x]
        rw [ hm, types_comp_apply] }
```
Thanks for the suggestion, that is of course better!

I think we should keep the `#align` statement:
```suggestion
        rw [ hm, types_comp_apply] }
#align category_theory.limits.types.filtered_colimit.is_colimit_of CategoryTheory.Limits.Types.FilteredColimit.isColimitOf
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Limits/TypesFiltered): remove existence of colimit assumption
